reactor.fn

Interface Resource

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Dispatcher, DispatcherSupplier
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLifecycleDispatcher, ExecutorPoweredProcessor, MpscDispatcher, MultiThreadDispatcher, ReactorProcessor, RingBufferDispatcher, RingBufferProcessor, RingBufferWorkProcessor, SingleThreadDispatcher, SynchronousDispatcher, TailRecurseDispatcher, ThreadPoolExecutorDispatcher, TraceableDelegatingDispatcher, WorkQueueDispatcher

    public interface Resource
    A Resource is a component with an active state, generally consuming hardware capacities (memory, cpu, io). The interface does not contract the creation of the resource but the closing methods, a graceful shutdown and an enforced shutdown.
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Stephane Maldini

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean alive()
      Determine whether this Resource can be used.
      boolean awaitAndShutdown()
      Block until all submitted tasks have completed, then do a normal shutdown().
      boolean awaitAndShutdown(long timeout, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Block until all submitted tasks have completed, then do a normal shutdown().
      void forceShutdown()
      Shutdown this Resource, forcibly halting any work currently executing and discarding any tasks that have not yet been executed.
      void shutdown()
      Shutdown this active Resource such that it can no longer be used.

    • Method Detail

      • alive

        boolean alive()
        Determine whether this Resource can be used.
        Returns:
        true if this Resource is alive and can be used, false otherwise.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shutdown this active Resource such that it can no longer be used. If the resource carries any work, it will wait (but NOT blocking the caller) for all the remaining tasks to perform before closing the resource.

      • awaitAndShutdown

        boolean awaitAndShutdown()
        Block until all submitted tasks have completed, then do a normal shutdown().

      • awaitAndShutdown

        boolean awaitAndShutdown(long timeout,
                         TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Block until all submitted tasks have completed, then do a normal shutdown().

      • forceShutdown

        void forceShutdown()
        Shutdown this Resource, forcibly halting any work currently executing and discarding any tasks that have not yet been executed.
